author: Mason Cole
title: Foxconn leader earns kudos for military support | News, Sports, Jobs - Tribune Chronicle
text:
LORDSTOWN — A supervisor at Foxconn was presented an award from Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve for his help in providing one of his employees the flexibility needed to serve in the National Guard.
Brent Williams, facilities maintenance supervisor at the Lordstown plant, received the Patriot Award from the Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve, an office of the United States Department of Defense, during a ceremony Thursday.
“Today is an important day for us at Foxconn, Ohio,” Matthew DeWine, external affairs representative for the company, said of the award.
Jim Fairbanks, a community outreach representative with Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve, said the organization’s goal is to keep Guard and Reserve members in their civilian jobs.
Fairbanks said the organization looks to keep employees who serve in the Guard or Reserve aware of their rights under the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act, a federal law adopted in 1994 that protects military service members and veterans from employment discrimination on the basis of their service, and allows them to regain their civilian jobs following a period of uniformed service, according to the U.S. Office of Special Counsel website.
Fairbanks, a Hubbard native, said his organization not only seeks to inform service members of their rights, but also to highlight employers who honor the reemployment rights act.
“It’s important that we also try to reward these employers because they take a real hit when the Guard and Reserve member is off for training in the summer, training on the weekends, and also, every one of us here knows someone who has been deployed a long time,” Fairbanks said. “Businesses who hire these people are taking a pretty good hit. We try to do everything we can to support the businesses with that.”
Fairbanks said Williams was nominated for the Patriot Award for his efforts including providing flexible schedules, time off before and after deployment, care for families and leaves of absence if needed.
Williams, who lives in Warren and has worked at Foxconn for three years, was nominated by one of his employees, a maintenance technician named Jarod Harvey.
Williams was thrilled to receive the award.
“It’s a nice honor,” Williams said. “I’ve always been a military supporter. I come from a strong military family. Although not a veteran myself, it’s always humbling to support that.”
Williams said he is glad his efforts were appreciated by Harvey.
“Jarod was a young man, one of my better employees,” Williams said. “It was nice to be able to support his Guard duty. I made an effort to check in on him, and he appreciated that.”
Shane Brown, vice president of EV manufacturing at Foxconn, thanked Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve for recognizing Williams with the award.
He said Foxconn strives to create an inclusive, healthy and welcoming workplace.
He said Foxconn is “extremely supportive” of all of its veterans and those serving in the National Guard and military reserve.
“Brent Williams is an example of how we live the culture that we promote,” Brown said.
Fairbanks said the Patriot Award is a prestigious honor. He said his organization has only given out two such awards in the past 12 months.
“It’s not all that common,” Fairbanks said. “It’s a big deal when we do it.”

title: El número de niños muertos en Cisjordania alcanza niveles sin precedentes: UNICEF | Aristegui Noticias
text: El número de niños muertos en Cisjordania alcanza niveles sin precedentes: UNICEF La directora General de UNICEF para Oriente Próximo y Norte de África, Adele Khodr, aseguró que 'los niños y niñas de Cisjordania están viviendo su propia pesadilla'. - Redacción AN / JGE El Fondo de Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF) recalcó que 2023 ‘ha sido el año más mortífero para la infancia’ en Cisjordania y Jerusalén en la historia y aseguró que ‘la violencia relacionada con el conflicto ha alcanzado niveles sin precedentes’. La directora regional de UNICEF para Oriente Próximo y Norte de África, Adele Khodr, declaró. En las últimas doce semanas, 83 niños y niñas han sido asesinados, más del doble de todos los niños y niñas asesinados en todo 2022, en medio de un aumento de las operaciones militares y de las fuerzas policiales (de Israel). ‘Mientras el mundo mira con horror la situación en la Franja de Gaza, los niños y niñas de Cisjordania están viviendo su propia pesadilla’, manifestó Khodr, que ha hecho hincapié en que ‘vivir con un sentimiento casi constante de miedo y dolor es, tristemente, demasiado común para los niños afectados’. Posteriormente, la directora regional lamentó. Muchos cuentan que el miedo se ha convertido en parte de su vida diaria, y que tienen miedo incluso de caminar hacia la escuela o de jugar al aire libre, debido a la amenaza de disparos y otro tipo de violencia relacionada con el conflicto. Además, agregó que ‘los niños que viven en Cisjordania, también en Jerusalén Este, han experimentado una demoledora violencia durante muchos años’ e insistió en que ‘la intensidad de esa violencia ha aumentado dramáticamente desde los terribles ataques del 7 de octubre’. Te puede interesar > [Hamás acusa a Israel de robar órganos de cuerpos palestinos](https://aristeguinoticias.com/2712/mundo/hamas-acusa-a-israel-de-robar-organos-de-cuerpos-palestinos/) La violencia relacionada con el conflicto ha matado a 124 niños y niñas palestinos y a seis niños y niñas israelíes desde comienzos de 2023. Por último, declaró El sufrimiento de los niños y niñas en Cisjordania, incluyendo Jerusalén Este, no debe quedar en segundo plano en medio del conflicto actual. Es parte de él. Horas antes, el Alto Comisionado de Derechos Humanos de Naciones Unidas, Volker Turk, alertó del ‘rápido deterioro’ de la situación de los Derechos Humanos en Cisjordania y Jerusalén Este desde el 7 de octubre. (Con información de Europa Press)

title: Controversial Claim by Shaman Durek Verrett Sparks Outrage: ‘Suicidal Spirit’ Exorcism Technique Causes Uproar
text:
SHAMAN: Durek Verrett.
Photo: Frode Hansen / VG
Petter Eide in the organization Leve reacts to Durek Verrett’s claim that there is a suicidal spirit that can be exorcised.
Published:
Less than 40 minutes ago
Updated just now
In a new
video on Instagram, Verrett says he will share shamanic knowledge and techniques on how to deal with suicide.
– Yes, we are talking about something heavy here, but it is important for us to be able to protect ourselves. In shamanism, we believe that there is a suicidal spirit, says Verrett, who is engaged to Princess Märtha Louise.
Verrett claims that one can get rid of the “suicidal spirit” themselves. He tells about a technique that will help you get this spirit out of you.
This technique involves, among other things, breathing and saying a few selected words to remove the “suicide spirit”.
– Almost at a loss for words
Petter Eide, chairman of Leve – the National Association for survivors of suicide – believes this is a life-threatening message.
– Here he makes a claim that suicide is caused by a spirit taking up residence in your body and that you should be able to drive it out with the help of your own thinking power. I hardly have words for how upset I get when I hear such nonsense. He plays with people’s lives, says Eide to VG.
Over 600 people take their own lives every year, according to the Norwegian Institute of Public
Health (FHI).
FHI does not have figures on attempts, but Eide believes that perhaps ten times as many attempt it or have suicidal thoughts every year.
LEVE: Petter Eide is chairman of the National Association for Survivors of Suicide.
Photo: Helge Mikalsen / VG
Eide points out that research on suicide shows that you should seek professional help and fellowship, not sit alone with your thoughts.
– Verrett pushes this exclusively back on the individual, without explanation or connection – just that an evil spirit has taken up residence in you that you can drive out yourself. What he says can make it worse.
– It is difficult to imagine him in the royal family with this type of attitude, says Eide, and points out that Durek Verrett is marrying Princess Märtha Louise in Geiranger this summer.
– Shamanism a supplement to the healthcare system
Durek Verrett has been submitted to the criticism, via his spokesperson in Norway, Simon Valvik.
Valvik says Verret’s content is intended for his followers and supporters who are familiar with his methods and practices of shamanism.
The majority of followers are Americans, not Norwegians, according to Valvik.
– In the
USA, there is closer contact between alternative medicine and school medicine. I see shamanism as a useful addition to the healthcare system, as many people in America also do, says Durek Verrett.
Those who do not agree with him do not have to follow him either, says Verrett.
At the same time, he says that he recognizes the importance of the
health system and school medicine.
– I respect what professionals, such as doctors and psychologists do, and I don’t try to tell them how to do their job. It’s about respecting each other and understanding that we all have different ways of helping people, says Verret.
He says that he wants to be able to offer an alternative to those who want it.
The press guard at the Castle tells VG that on a general basis they do not comment on statements from Durek Verrett.
Need someone to talk to?
By for urgent crisis assistance, you must call 113. If you want to get in touch with your local emergency room, call 116 117.
There are several helplines, chat services and support groups where you can share your thoughts and feelings completely anonymously, and get support, advice and guidance.

author: Sandeep Rai
title: Amroha's 'Radio Man' Featured in 'Mann ki Baat' Gets Special Invite to R-Day Parade | Meerut News - Times of India
text: MEERUT: Nine months after being featured in TOI and two months post his mention in Prime Minister Modi's 'Mann ki Baat', 67-year-old Ram Singh Baudh, owner of 1,100 radios, has received a special invite for the Republic Day parade, including a five-day stay at Delhi's Ashoka Hotel and visits to important sites.\"It's beyond my comprehension. Since PM broadcasts his messages on the radio, getting a mention from him in Mann ki Baat was certainly a dream come true. Still, this invite is a next-level acknowledgement,\" said Baudh, holding a letter of invitation from the Ministry of Defence and a letter from Prasar Bharti.Notably, all those mentioned in the PM's monthly radio address have been invited. The letter signed by deputy director Prasar Bharti, Mukesh Kumar stated, \"You are among the honoured guests who found mention in the PM's Mann ki Baat. We invite you to witness the 75th Republic Day parade.\" Retired from the Warehouse Corporation of India, Baudh spends most of his time with his collection of 1,100 radios, gathered over the years spending lakhs of rupees from different junk markets of Delhi, Meerut and several other towns. \"The future generation will never get to know of the significance of the radio evolution that's still impacting our lives in the modern form and hence decided to begin the collection\", says Baudh who remembers spending his entire monthly salary to purchase his first radio in 1977 for Rs 350. Today, his oldest radio, made in 1900 with 'Made in England' engraved on it, represents the evolution of radio technology in India. In the 107th edition of 'Mann Ki Baat' on November 26, PM Modi highlighted the impact of the programme on making radio more popular in households. Baudh, from Amroha in Uttar Pradesh, was acknowledged for his decades-long radio collection. His museum gained increased curiosity after the Mann Ki Baat mention, as mentioned in a letter received by the PM on 'MYGOV'.

author: Europa Press
title: La inestabilidad dominará la península y Balears con abundante nubosidad y chubascos débiles
text: La Agencia estatal de meteorología (AEMET) prevé que la inestabilidad persista en la Península y en Illes Balears, con abundante nubosidad y probables precipitaciones débiles que afectarán a zonas de la mitad sur, tercio nordeste y entorno mediterráneo. En especial, se pronostica que estas lluvias sean más intensas y podrán llegar a fuertes e ir con tormenta en el nordeste de Catalunya, Alborán y litorales del sureste peninsular. A su vez, podrían darse nevadas débiles en puntos del Sistema Central, sur de la Ibérica, montañas del sureste, y de forma más probable, en el Pirineo, con acumulaciones significativas al principio del día en su extremo oriental. En este marco, la cota de nieve se situará en torno a 1200\/1600 metros (m). A medida que avance el día, se espera que las precipitaciones tiendan en general a menos y que se abran cada vez más claros, aunque se mantendrán las precipitaciones en el oeste de Galicia. Mientras, en Canarias, predominarán los cielos nubosos en las islas montañosas con probables chubascos ocasionales y los intervalos nubosos en el resto. Además, habrá probables brumas y bancos de niebla matinales en zonas de montañas e interiores del este peninsular. En lo que respecta a las temperaturas, el organismo estatal avisa de que las máximas estarán en aumento en los tercios este y sur peninsulares y que en líneas generales se mantendrán sin grandes cambios en el resto. Paralelamente, las mínimas subirán en los archipiélagos y en el extremo oeste peninsular, mientras que predominarán las bajadas en el resto. Durante esta jornada, las heladas seguirán afectando a la mayor parte de interiores de la mitad norte peninsular y a entornos de montaña del sureste, sin descartarlas en el este la meseta sur. Éstas podrán ser localmente fuertes en montañas del extremo norte. Las capitales de provincia que registrarán valores más bajos será León con -3ºC, Burgos, Lugo, Palencia, Salamanca y Soria con -2ºC; y Ávila, Segovia, Valladolid y Zamora con -1ºC. Por último, la predicción recoge que soplarán vientos moderados del norte y nordeste en la mitad norte del área mediterránea, con vientos flojos variables con predominio de las componentes este y sur en el resto. A lo largo del día se espera una tendencia a rolar a componente oeste. Asimismo, habrá vientos del este y sureste en Canarias, flojos al principio pero tendiendo a arreciar.

author: Rachel Yen
title: Nebraska Enacts Landmark Law to Steer Troubled Veterans Away from Incarceration and into Treatment
text: Nebraska Enacts Landmark Law to Steer Troubled Veterans Away from Incarceration and into Treatment The state is the first in the nation to adopt a policy framework from the Veterans Justice Commission, a CCJ panel led by 2 former U.S. Defense Secretaries FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE April 18, 2024 Contact: Jenifer Warren [jwarren@counciloncj.org](mailto:jwarren@counciloncj.org) 916-217-0780 WASHINGTON – Nebraska Gov. Jim Pillen has signed [landmark legislation](https://nebraskalegislature.gov/bills/view_bill.php?DocumentID=49866) that creates alternatives to prosecution and incarceration for military veterans, ensuring they receive treatment for PTSD and other service-related conditions that drive their criminal behavior. The governor’s action makes Nebraska the first state to adopt legislation based on a [policy framework](https://counciloncj.foleon.com/veterans-commission/vjc-reports/model-policy-framework) from the [Veterans Justice Commission,](https://counciloncj.org/veterans-justice-commission/) a national panel led by former U.S. Defense Secretaries Chuck Hagel and Leon Panetta. The [Council on Criminal Justice](https://counciloncj.org/) launched the 15-member commission of senior military and criminal justice leaders to examine why so many veterans land in prison and jail and develop solutions. Under the new law, veterans who demonstrate that a service-related condition contributed to their offense can be diverted from prosecution by a judge. Those eligible will instead be required to complete a structured program combining supervision with individualized treatment for PTSD, traumatic brain injury, or other conditions. Only certain crimes currently eligible for probation will be considered for diversion, and victims will have the opportunity to address the court. Hagel said the approach complements Veterans Treatment Courts in providing the court system with options to assist veterans and will help more veterans manage the invisible wounds of war. Nationally, 14% of counties operate specialized veterans courts, and [eligibility requirements exclude many veterans](https://counciloncj.foleon.com/veterans-commission/report-1/recommendation-two). “People who have served this nation in our armed forces have sacrificed to protect all of us,” Hagel said. “This law recognizes that sacrifice by ensuring that our veterans are not lost in our prisons and jails, but instead receive interventions that can help them resume their responsibilities to their families, their communities, and their country.” More than 200,000 active-duty service members leave the armed forces each year, and while most transition successfully, [many struggle](https://assets.foleon.com/eu-central-1/de-uploads-7e3kk3/41697/preliminary_assessment.53512ca15229.pdf) with mental health and substance use disorders, the effects of traumatic brain injury, homelessness, and criminality. Roughly one in three veterans report having been arrested and booked into jail at least once. Veterans who become incarcerated lose access to health care from the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), which prevents them from receiving the specialized treatment they need to address PTSD or other challenges. The suicide rate for veterans is approximately 1.5 times higher than the rate among the general population, and it’s [especially high](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32147866/) for veterans leaving incarceration. “Too often, we are prosecuting and imprisoning veterans whose criminal justice involvement is due, at least in part, to their service to our country,” said Commission Director Jim Seward. “This law builds on the success of veterans treatment courts, giving former service members who become entangled in our justice system a second chance while also holding them accountable for their actions.” Seward added that the approach was adopted as [model policy](https://alec.org/model-policy/veterans-justice-act/) by the American Legislative Exchange Council (ALEC) last year, and that other states are expected to follow Nebraska’s lead. In addition to the policy framework that underpins the Nebraska law, the Commission has produced two sets of findings and recommendations related to [arrest through sentencing](https://counciloncj.foleon.com/veterans-commission/vjc-reports/arrest-through-sentencing) and the [transition from military service to civilian life](https://counciloncj.foleon.com/veterans-commission/vjc-reports/transition). A third set, regarding incarceration and reentry, is due for release later this year. CCJ launched the two-year Commission in August 2022 to assess the extent and nature of veterans’ justice-system involvement, the adequacy of support for service members as they return home, and the effectiveness of the system response when veterans break the law. In addition to Hagel and Panetta, Commission members include a former Sergeant Major of the Marine Corps, the chief justice of the Georgia Supreme Court, two formerly incarcerated veterans, and other top military, veterans, and criminal justice leaders. About the Council on Criminal Justice The Council on Criminal Justice (CCJ) is a nonpartisan invitational membership organization and think tank that advances understanding of the criminal justice policy challenges facing the nation and builds consensus for solutions based on facts, evidence, and fundamental principles of justice.

title: Une demi-finale européenne 32 ans après pour Bruges qui s’impose au PAOK et se met à rêver
text: - Ferran Jutglà 33' 45' Une demi-finale européenne 32 ans après pour Bruges qui s’impose au PAOK et se met à rêver 31 ans après le dernier club belge (l’Antwerp), 32 ans après leur défaite face au Werder de Brème en 1992, les Brugeois vont disputer une demi-finale européenne, et même deux car ça sera une double confrontation. Les Blauw en Zwart affronteront la Fiorentina, qui a défait le Viktoria Plzen. Après un match maîtrisé du début à la fin, les Brugeois se sont imposés en Grèce grâce un un doublé de leur attaquant espagnol Ferran Jutglà en première mi-temps. Les Brugeois avaient remporté le match aller en Belgique 1-0 jeudi passé, où ils auraient pu (dû) marquer l’un ou l’autre but supplémentaire. title: Massive California waves injure some onlookers and bring flooding, treacherous beach conditions up the West coast - Local News 8
text:
By Elizabeth Wolfe, Robert Shackelford and Cindy Von Quednow, CNN
(CNN) — A powerful offshore storm is driving towering waves into the California coastline, triggering flooding and warnings of dangerous and damaging swells after several people were injured by a wave along Ventura beach on Thursday.
The wave crashed over a barrier along the southern California beach, tossing a wall of fast-moving water at a group of onlookers who rushed to escape the deluge, witness video shows. Seawater quickly knocked some people off their feet and pummeled cars as drivers tried to speed away.
Nearly 20 people were briefly swept away in the incident and eight people were taken to the hospital, Ventura officials said.
High water and dangerous rip currents will churn along some of California’s beaches through the weekend as much of the West coast – spanning from the US-Mexico border to southern Oregon – is under coastal flood and high-surf alerts, the National Weather Service said.
Waves as high as telephone poles – about 40 feet – could slam into San Francisco through Friday morning. Fifteen to 20-foot waves are expected along the central coast.
The dangerous conditions pose an “exceptional risk” of ocean drowning and damage to structures like piers and jetties, the National Weather Service said.
The spectacular waters have enthralled some surfers and onlookers, but weather officials are cautioning that the waves and strong rip tides can be perilous for those nearby.
“Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore,” the National Weather Service warned.
At least one fisherman fell overboard in a harbor off Oxnard and later came ashore uninjured, the Ventura County Fire Department said.
The conditions have already caused some road closures and evacuations in coastal California communities and prompted the rescue of five campers along the San Luis Obispo coast.
Crews in Ventura worked through the night to reinforce a mile-long sand barrier that was damaged by powerful waters on Thursday, the local fire department said. Standing about seven feet tall, the raised wall helps protect beachside communities.
Hoping to discourage spectators, local officials closed a main access point to Ventura Pier, which saw a swell of about 20 feet on Thursday. Some coastal streets in the area have also been closed as a precaution.
In central California’s Santa Cruz, the sheriff’s office issued an evacuation warning for some areas on Thursday, which included areas of Rio Del Mar, where seawater filled beachside roadways and pushed against some homes, CNN affiliate KION reported. The warnings were lifted later in the day.
The most extreme impacts were expected along the central and Ventura County coasts, along with Hermosa, Manhattan and Palos Verdes beaches, the weather service in Los Angeles said Thursday.
Tempestuous waters are also battering Northern California, where the Bay Area could see waves of 28 to 33 feet, the weather service advised.
A high wind alert is also in effect for the Bay Area on Friday as wind gusts of up to 50 mph are expected.
Rainfall is likely to stretch northward from the Bay Area throughout the day Friday before shifting south into the weekend.
Massive waves attract surfers to Mavericks
Despite safety warnings, the massive waves are a welcome sight to surfers hungry to tackle the legendary swells at Mavericks Beach, about 25 miles south of San Francisco.
Pro surfers and spectators flocked to the beach on Thursday for a competition at the site known for having some of the biggest waves in the world, CNN affiliate KGO reported.
Local resident Ion Banner told the affiliate that surfers from Brazil, Tahiti and Hawaii were out in the water. “It’s pretty gnarly, it’s super big,” he said.
“The waves looked absolutely massive and it was everything that we expected,” said Miguel Blanco, who told KGO he flew in from Portugal to surf the waves. “It was really big, I’d say 40-60 foot waves.”
Mavericks’ jaw-dropping waves – caused by unique underwater rock formations – reach their biggest heights in the winter, when big wave surfers from all over the world make pilgrimages to face the swells.
The legendary waves and the surfers who brave them have been the subject of several films and documentaries, including the 2012 biopic “Chasing Mavericks” about American surfer Jay Moriarity’s journey to surf Mavericks as a teen.
On Thursday, the conditions were prime for surfers like Blanco.
“If it’s your turn, you just gotta go,” Blanco said. “When you see a big wave, you’re kinda scared but at the same time you’re feeling like you should go and you just go and enjoy the ride.”
CNN’s David Williams contributed to this report.
